intro: Arthrocarpum somalense, commonly known as the Somali spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal regions. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has potential medicinal uses.
